one_liner: This technique reviews and compares various methods for detecting hate speech and ideological extremism in text data.
how_it_works: The technique involves collecting a set of studies on hate speech detection and categorizing the approaches used. Each approach is evaluated based on performance metrics such as accuracy and F1-score. The effectiveness of these methods is then compared to draw conclusions about their relative strengths and weaknesses.

steps: 1. Collect a comprehensive set of studies on hate speech detection.
2. Categorize the approaches used in these studies.
3. Evaluate the performance metrics of each approach.
4. Compare the effectiveness of each approach.
5. Draw conclusions based on comparative performance.
algorithm.core_equation: output = classify(text) where classification is based on performance metrics
algorithm.input_format: Text data from social media posts and comments.
algorithm.output_format: Classification of text as hate speech, extremist content, or neutral.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.effect: Adjusting this value changes the sensitivity of the detection.

parameters.name: min_word_count
parameters.effect: Increasing this value may reduce false positives by requiring more context.

complexity.practical_note: Performance may vary significantly based on the dataset and methods used.

use_when: Building systems for social media moderation
avoid_when: When real-time detection is critical without prior training
In low-resource environments without sufficient data
common_mistakes: Neglecting to account for the context of the text data.

Helps identify the most effective approaches for specific contexts.
Facilitates informed decision-making in system design.
weaknesses: May not account for the latest advancements in detection techniques.
